title: Nidalee jungle has 52% win rate, but only 47.5% win rate overall
body:
And here is the reason: 

http://i.imgur.com/HR42C7H.png

This is why you shouldn't trust Lolking win rates

Also Nid mid and top aren't so great either

replies.body: I am so glad someone pointed this out.  Mid Nid is so bad due to all the push mages.  Its embarrassing how quickly she loses her tower

Showing again that champs do not always have to be buffed or nerfed, you just have to wait for the right meta. ( Yes Nidalee did receive some nerfs, but not to her damage that was the annoying part, it was to health and health regen and what not).

no, she did receive nerfs, that were unwarranted.

They came to her Bushwhack's damage. Instead of doing %max over 4 seconds per trap, they now deal flat damage. Essentially, they're useless now aside from zoning and rooting jungle camps. They're worthless in a teamfight too because of their arming time, and they don't apply any CC either.
It's never done % Max they nerfed it from % current and a flat to a pure flat.

Good stuff. Probably also explains why her winrate jumped quite a bit in Diamond last I checked (fewer people playing her off-role). What did you use to get these numbers?

I just want to know who those 0.2% are who are playing her ADC XD

> [{quoted}](name=kcStranger,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OgZ7NlV5,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-03T04:25:26.698+0000)
>
> Good stuff. Probably also explains why her winrate jumped quite a bit in Diamond last I checked (fewer people playing her off-role). What did you use to get these numbers?
> 
> I just want to know who those 0.2% are who are playing her ADC XD

the 0.2% know how to play league

http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/nidalee/jungle/all

Don't EVER use Lolking for win rates, that shit is so misleading bc things Bronzies does will always dominate the stat. This website breakdown win rates by elo, role, and even skill orders. Gives you a way more complete picture.

Personally, I would always look at winrates across levels of ranked and take into consideration how much pro attention a champion was getting (and popularity/ban rates) when trying to make judgments based on winrates. It can still be really deceiving, though. (Kassadin was probably the champ that taught me the most about being careful with winrates; his performance in solo queue was total crap even though pros were showing he was good.) This site seems like a solid step up; thanks :D
